Contradict fact: The claim falsely states that the City ID Cards in Chicago allow illegal immigrants to vote in local, state, and federal elections.
Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the impact of the City ID Cards by stating that they "illegally collude with foreigners to interfere in our elections."
Lack enough support: The claim does not provide sufficient evidence or support to back up its assertion that the City ID Cards allow illegal immigrants to vote.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the City ID Cards are being used to enable illegal immigrants to vote, without providing any evidence to support this assumption.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim ignores the fact that the City ID Cards are available to all Chicago residents, regardless of immigration status, and can be used for identification purposes, including voter registration for eligible U.S. citizens.
